title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
This is a legit Forza Horizon competitor, that is not just trying to replicate a Forza game, but is actually trying to compete with it, AND IT WORKS. 

I decided the day before that i am NOT gonna buy it, because what the f... is a 60 FPS cap in late 2024, going 2025, but then i saw them announcing a lot of free content coming to the game and i decided to give it a go since they are still working hard on it.

And, boy, its beautiful. I have only 5 hours in, but i can easily see 30-40-50+ more. To my big surprise, the 60 FPS limit is not bugging me that much, i can live with it.

One thing they can improve is the cockpit view, i drove a lot of hours in first person in FH5, but it doesnt look nice here.

Other than that game looks great, DO YOU UbiSoft, DO YOU. With FH5 being kinda soulless y'all might be up for taking the throne of this kind of games with the next installment. Just dont release it with another 60 FPS limit, coz im not gonna buy it :D

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
I’ve been playing The Crew Motorfest and I’m genuinely impressed! 
After playing so many Ubisoft titles, I didn't expect what it turned out to be. First off, the map is vast, diverse, and really fun to explore. Lots of interesting and fun races and modes. The graphics are lovely, the physics of the vehicles feels interesting, as it does for an arcade game, and there’s a huge variety of cars and customization options to dive into. The audio design, including the soundtrack, complements the experience perfectly.
I've played Need for Speed: Payback, Unbound, and both Forza Horizon 4 and 5, and I have to say, I enjoy this game more. Right now, it feels like it's worth every penny, especially with the Steam discount! The future also looks bright, thanks to the "Playlists" system, which brings a lot of variety to the races and seems like it will continue to expand the game with fresh content, and we have a major update coming soon with a new island.
That said, there is one drawback: optimization. My 2022 setup handles 2K resolution decently, but sometimes there are drops in frames from stable 58-60, to 50, and it is felt. More advanced settings could really help smooth things out. Ubisoft could certainly work on polishing that aspect, and add some advanced settings.
Overall, I’d give it a solid 𝟖/𝟏𝟎 as an arcade racing game, and I think it could even challenge Forza in some ways. Well done, Ivory Tower/Ubisoft!
(P.S. I've spent about 60 hours playing the game, and by this point my review looks like this).

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
TL;DR : Yes this game is very similar to Forza Horizon 5, to the point I'd say it's FH5 with much fewer microtransactions, ACTUAL steering animations and a much, much better map which is worth the exploration, all of which leading to a great game totally worth checking out!

Actual review : 
This game is my first experience with The Crew as a franchise, so I went in with no prior expectations whatsoever, and it got me hooked from the get-go!
The Hawaii map is really gorgeous from the lush tropical beachside to the cities and highways and everything in-between! 
The soundtracks are really cool and come in different variations to match the vibes of any race or free-roam cruise you are experiencing.
The graphics and animations are nice, nothing breathtaking but also nothing short of great, and I'm surprised to see how many small details are here and there from your avatar resting their arm while cruising in interior camera to the handling animations while riding a bike, and speaking of handling, vehicles are much smoother to handle & drive than I've expected, it's still no FH5, but it's serviceable and gets the job done.
The multiplayer experience has been smooth so far as well with no server issues and a quick matchmaking (Grand races are sooooo fun!!) and as for PVE, you have summit which is your weekly leaderboard playlist which is fun but nothing special, and then you have my favorite part which is the many playlists you have in the game. So far I've only finished Made In Japan, and it was a really rewarding blast, and upon finishing any playlist you get to unlock challenges for that specific playlist as well, which adds more replayability and offers more awards. 
You also have a much better sense of progression in this game compared to many modern racing games as the game offers a rather mediocre car at the beginning, and you have to grind your way to getting more cars and other vehicles which are also required to open some playlists.
As of writing this review, there are +700 vehicles in the game and only two of them are locked behind an actual paywall , all the rest are available to obtain using the in-game currency.
They are also adding a FREE map expansion later this year, and an OFFLINE MODE, both of which are the icing on the cake as for why this game is totally worth it, at least when it goes on sale. 

And lastly, while I'm aware it's an Ubisoft game, and as we all know Ubisoft is a big NO for many gamers these days for many good reasons, looking at what Ivory Towers (the actual developers) have pulled off with this game makes me really hopeful for their future and I hope they get more love and attention with their future releases, and the current additions of offline mode to Crew 2 and Motorfest and the huge discounts they both got is a very big & important step in that direction.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Firstly~ no wonder this game was on sale! The year one pass which is included in the ultimate edition, is glitched and will not allow me to use cars in which i paid for.

Upon further research this has been a bug for a whole year. For this I cannot in good conscience recommend this game.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
(Yap fest incoming) (428 hours on Xbox) When I heard this game was coming out, the only reason I was hyped about it was because it was based on one of my favorite Hawaiian Islands, but I could tell they took one too many pages out of horizons book, on top of the $70 price tag and the removal of The Crew 1, I was pretty disinterested pretty quickly.

A few weeks passed by and I was getting pretty tired of Forza Horizon 5, I started seeing videos about how lackluster the game really was and how flavorless the map is, not to mention the reused content and constant flow of stupid car passes that seem cheap, but add up over time. I love Arcade Racers and having to drop Forza Horizon like that wasn't easy, but around the same time I heard The Crew MotorFest was on sale, and from the videos I saw there weren't many negative things people were saying about it, so I picked it up. 

I mean this with all seriousness, I have not had this much fun with an arcade racer since Forza Horizon 3's peak. Literally my only concern about the game was if it was ever going to shut down one day just like the first game, because I want to pass my game accounts down to my children. But I'm happy to say, they have announced that The Crew 2 and MotorFest will be getting offline patches. They made stupid decisions back then and they learned. Looking forward to this game's future. 

I could go on and on about why I love this game so much compared to everything else on the market but that would take forever, besides The Crew game's go on sale all the time, so when they do, pick it up if you are looking for raw fun, because I've purchased this game four times, on all different kinds of platforms, and I don't regret it one bit. Well.. besides the Xbox one version, that was practically unplayable. 

And I'm not going to pretend it doesn't have it's problems, but from what I've observed from the past year they are all ears to the community, and they have clearly taken action in many aspects. (If a dev reads this please fix the players disappearing in the open world, add more PVP options, and unlock the fps.. please lol)

Also if you're wondering how I got my Xbox account to Steam, I literally just added Ubisoft Connect to my Xbox and then logged in with the same account on PC. Good job Ubisoft, Never thought I'd say that. Or if I ever will again.

(Update 9/12/24) It seems both games are being review bombed over old information, what I'll say is millions that may not be in a financial position to be spending 60 / 70 dollars on video games now have the opportunity to do so, which is great. The Crew 1 is gone, I'm not happy about it ether, but we should be rewarding good behavior. And to whoever is saying "They won't stick to there word about offline" I don't know if you noticed but the E.U. will be at Ubisoft's door soon, so stop conspiring and just have fun.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: You basically waste your money to drive loaned vehicles instead of your own, Just buy The Crew 2. It has a better system and it's currently 1€

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
If you are looking to play this and think it is another Forza Horizon, then you are not too far off. The game itself is one of the more better racing games on the market today. Ubisoft did a excellent job of creating a beautiful environment to drive and discover, with much detail and care in gameplay and while still maintaining the arcade physics of the handling of the vehicles. The game has beautiful and stunning visuals and eye candy, with the scenery and also with many vehicles to race and collect. Overall this game has a good fun factor and any true racing fan should have this game in their library. Unlike in the Forza Horizon series there are also countless planes, boats, bikes to collect and race as well, giving a huge variety of races to participate in. The combined beautiful landscape and the different themes of style of races on the island itself, makes this really that much more enjoyable and worth the time to play through and take in. The storyline which is also a simple and straight forward goal to just become the best ultimate racer in this motorsport competition. Many options are also presented to the player, as they can customize gameplay accordingly to their preferences and skill. The background soundtracks used in this game are good, many that will get you more in the mood as you play this often and over time you then begin to enjoy hearing them more, as they often blend well with the game's atmosphere and race theme setting. The music consists of rock, techno, drum and bass, new wave, classics from the 50's, 60's, 70's and 80's style music. So, with the above mentioned it is very much a polished racing game at it's peak right now. There are some flaws here and there, but nothing that can be seriously noticed right away to any casual players who just want to experience something all over again with the feeling of arcade style racing.

Now the things that may need some addressing, first off is the online races. I feel that in most cases with any online racing that everyone has different skill and of course that means, there are players who are advanced and some just looking to have fun. What i found out is the online races in this are somewhat of a limitation to what kinds of vehicles the player uses in order to have a huge advantage over those with less skill. Example is: That if a player goes with the choice of having anything that is considered vintage or vehicles that are just slow in general, then prepare to get beaten every time. The races are mixed and with no expectations of being pared up with someone who has the same class or tier of car to go against. In general the online races feel not very balanced and more less forced to have something "as good" as the other player has, (only modern era vehicles will do anything in these races). I'm very happy to hear they will soon offer an offline mode coming soon for this game, purely for the reasons above about online races.

What else is there?

Another flaw that I think most of us have noticed is that when doing a playlist for the first time, we are loaned specific vehicles to take part in those races. This kind of defeats the purpose of upgrading and collecting vehicles that you want to use in scenario's of entering each single catagory of tier in that playlist. I kind of understand that at the same time the playlists would become much more easy and less fun, if everyone was going to use a upgraded hypercar to beat them. At least it is nice that they also included the option to customize these events after you beat the playlist challenges. Customizing the playlists do add a desire to just use the vehicle you want and how you want it, while it also gives the player a chance to practice driving specific vehicles in races VS bots of any level of difficulty of settings and preference for the custom event.

With all the above said, I do recommend buying this game when it is on sale or at regular price. It is a very polished and beautiful racing game to have and play for all levels of players. Support Ubisoft and so they will make more games like this in the future.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
I recently bought The Crew 2 as it was on sale for $1, and I had played it on console a while ago. It is still an amazing game. Then I see Motorfest is on sale as well, and you can transfer cars, which I thought was a nice addition. So after playing The Crew 2 for a few days I bought Motorfest.

 My initial reactions were not good. The intro was ok, but then you are forced to choose a playlist, which I didn't want to do, as I hadn't even been in the actual game yet, and I wasn't sure what I was even picking. I then choose a playlist and enter the game. Immediately disliked the amount and SIZE of all of the popups that flood your screen. I still haven't found out if there is a way to reduce the size of virtually everything.

Then, of course, there is the playlists. Where The Crew 2 had, in my opinion, a fabulous system for organized and separate racing disciplines, The Crew Motorfest has NOTHING of the sort. EVERY SINGLE PLAYLIST is 100% loaned cars. The cars you own are only for replaying races already completed and PVP races.

Want a playlist strictly for touring cars? Too bad! Want a playlist where you just get to race without NPC's giving you a storyline about the plot and background? Too bad! Motorfest has stripped virtually all of the progression that made the previous Crew games fun, and FORCE you to use other people's cars.

The map... good lord... the map. Hawaii should have been a DLC for The Crew 2. I want cross-country interstates, long snaking back-roads, mountain passes, and coastal roads that go on for what feels like an eternity. I feel like the enormous maps are kind of a staple for Crew games, no? The map is WAY too small compared to previous Crew games.

Now the positive part. The graphics are very good. The sound design and quality... SUBLIME. Map quality and feel (regardless of size) is also very nice. I'm sort of torn on the handling, while I understand others' praise for the more simcade feel, which I like, I also loved the more arcade feel of handling in The Crew 2, just my preference.

This is a GOOD GAME, I just can't say I think it is a good Crew game. It feels nothing like the previous Crew games. I understand games are supposed to change and evolve, but I feel this changed in many ways I wasn't hoping it to.

I cannot recommend this game to fans of previous Crew games who loved them for the same reasons I did.

Lastly, please let us set TCS, ESC, and ABS PER VEHICLE!

Thank you.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Reasons to pick this up over TDU:SC (for now)

+ Does not use server cloud computing. Meaning if the servers are congested, then the whole game suffers in terms of graphics and performance.

+ 'Better' Graphics. I found TDUSC to be "muddy" and "smeary". TCMF is also far more varied in environment, plus the colors pop out a lot more.

+ Offline mode is being worked on (around November). TDUSC is planned, but nothing concrete as of yet.

+ More Racing Modes / Styles. TDUSC focuses on road and off-road racing, but they feel too janky.

+ Bikes and other vehicle types. I wish more racing games allowed you to use not only boats and planes, but also bikes. MCLA was the last game I've played that had Bikes on a racing game that wasn't solely focused on it.

4 Shakas out of 5.

And for mutliplayer, Grand Races are fun for a while, but the lack of normal races in MP is probably the dumbest idea i've seen in a Racing games

title: The Crew Motorfest

One of the biggest surprises was that it allowed me to import my car collection from The Crew 2 on PS4. That was a huge help!

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: Its a good game, very well done but a bad racing game. Also side note- I have had to mute the voice overs, its not story telling its annoying and never ending.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
i meann this game is alright. i dont like the fact that they literally removed the main thing about this franchise (whole america map), but i do love the map detailing and quality. i just wish they made the game have more races, and add more traffic.

if you like tropical vibes, car sounds and fast cars, go with this game. if you like america and games that have massive maps, go with the crew 2.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
4 server disconnections in less than 1 hour trying to adjust the settings in the game's benchmark tool. When I started the game, even in the intro, I noticed the performance issues that the game has on my PCs with stutterings causing an inconsistent framerate on my ROG Ally Z1E and on my desktop PC Ryzen 7900X3D + 2080 Ti, both installed on NVME SSDs. Forced TAA antialiasing, 60 FPS limit and no fullscreen mode with the possibility of resolution adjustment, no FSR or DLSS. I wanted to give the game a chance because the news that an offline mode for the game is possibly being developed by Ubisoft is great, but the quality of the port on PC is not good for me, who knows when the patches are released and with a bigger discount besides the -70% or reduction of the base price.

PT-BR:

4 desconexões dos servidores em menos de 1 hora tentando ajustar as configurações na ferramenta de benchmark do jogo. Quando iniciei o jogo ainda na introdução percebi os problemas de performance que o jogo tem nos meus PCs com stutterings causando um framerate inconsistente no meu ROG Ally Z1E e no meu PC desktop Ryzen 7900X3D + 2080 Ti ambos instalados em SSDs NVME. Antialiasing TAA forçado, limite de 60 FPS e não possui modo tela cheia com possibilidade de ajuste de resolução, sem FSR ou DLSS. Queria dar uma chance para o jogo pois a noticia de que possivelmente o modo offline para o jogo está sendo desenvolvido pela Ubisoft é ótimo mas a qualidade do port no PC para mim não está legal, quem sabe quando os patchs forem lançados e com mais desconto além dos -70% ou redução do preço base.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
I was hyped for this games release and while it is a fairly good game it just feels like a forza horizon copy with a few differences.
The playlists are weird and having use loaner cars for every race you do the first time is a horrible idea whats the point of having and upgrading your own cars if you never get to use them. My second biggest gripe is the map, its not bad and it is very detailed and a nice place to drive around and explore but what made the crew stand out in the first place was the HUGE map in the first and second game it made it feel special like no other arcade racer offered a playable area of that scale.
The Graphics are great and the details like steering wheel and shifter movements are great, the driving physics are vastly improved as well, if they made another game with the scale of Crew 1&2 with the polish and feel of Motorfest it would be an epic game.
If you can get Motorfest on sale its a decent buy otherwise imo The Crew 2 offers way more to do and better value

review: The game is for sale and i get excited cause its the rival to forza  horizon. I saw reviews of it saying the game crashes but i bought anyways thinking it has to be working by now. Well after 30 mins and 6 crashes i was not able to race once. The servers are a joke and the game has been out for a year. Its super bad im very disappointed. Dont be scammed by Ubisoft . They are literally the worst gaming company .

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: i was so exited to get this game but the handling is literally just a heavy car and slippery tires and the motercycles what i was most exited for is literally you just riding a png in first person which is horrible compared to what was done in the crew 2

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
It looks much better than The Crew 2, and the map feels more thoughtfully designed and filled with content. I also really like the themed missions.

There’s an option to bring your car collection from The Crew 2, though not entirely, as there are a few exceptions. Still, it’s a nice feature.

Offline mode and a new island, which will nearly double the size of the world, are on the way.

Don’t waste your money on the more expensive editions. The Year 1 Pass only had two exclusive cars; the rest can be purchased with in-game currency. Essentially, you’re just paying for early access.

Wait for a sale—it's too expensive otherwise.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Let me draw an abstract comparison. Watch Dogs 2, a game great for many reasons, one of which is that it made 'nerdy' characters relatable. The conversations the protagonists in that game had were dumb, but they were relatable in a way. 

This game tries to do that and by God it does such a fucking horrible job at it. It's a DRIVING game. And a good one! Genuinely without the horribly written dialogue it would be so much better. 

Anyway, aside from that, it's a good game! The driving feels fucking amazing, the environment is great, the animations are great in first person, they feel somewhat natural unlike most games where you move the wheel like, 10°. I can't speak for whether this game is culturally insensitive or not so I'm just not gonna go into thst topic. 

Genuinely this is a fun game, I've had a blast with it so far, but some things do drag it back. 

Oh, and support the people working on TCU. Ubisoft did a scummy move there, they've promised not to do it again but believing that is like believing Simon Harris when he says he cares about kids with scoliosis.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
[h3]Compared to other arcade racing games (NFS, FH4/5):[/h3]
- One of the best audio (+)
- Great map (looks nice, doesn't feel empty like in FH5) (+)
- Good graphics, no ray tracing :( (+)
- For no f###ing reason, capped at 60 fps (+/-)
- Car handling is very arcade and most cars feel like they weight 10t while being glued to the floor. I like it but don't expect Forza driving experience (+/- -)
- No offline, you can't play offline and with bad/unstable internet you will get randomly disconnected (I heard that offline will be added) (-)
- Simple AI, basically  follow the line AI barely ever overtake each other (can overtake you just right oven sometimes from nowhere),  have different driving styles in custom mode (-)
- Upgrade system, each category have different parts that you have to grind + plus all cars have +/- same max speed and acceleration without maxing the cars they are riding on ice in some cases (-)
[h3]Compared to the Crew 2:[/h3]
- Better Graphics(+)
- Mostly better audio(+)
- Car handling... Better, but feels weird, heavy, sometimes like you have to fight it on corners. Still usually glued to the floor. In both esp and TRC/TCS is recommended in the crew 2 it only made you worst on corners here you randomly start sliding(+)
- Map is side grade smaller but better done with more details and no random floating objects (sidegrade)
- AI is same bullshit but now with modifiers (same lol)
- Now you can change engine sound (it's premium cosmetic tho....)(+)

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: I have more than what is required to run this game tenfold, however i played for thirty minutes and it crashed ten times. This is by far one of the worst experiences i have ever had playing a game. A true Ubisoft specail.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: one of, if not the best car game ive played. But theres ONE thing... PLEASE MAKE THE FPS CAP HIGHER THAN 60!!!!!!! IT IS GIVING ME A HEADACHE TRYING TO LOOK AROUND BECAUSE ITS SO CHOPPY PLEASE ADD MORE FPS LIMITS OR IMMA CRASH OUT

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Top pros for me:
+steering, best arcade steering I experienced. Yes, i played forza and this one seems more immersing for me. Forza one is too "gummy" or "plasticine" for me. This just seems more "mechanical" and I like it a lot. So, if someone shares same feeling about FH5, this is it. Sense of weight is quite simmilar, so very good in both cases.
+++lighting - breathtaking by occasion
+map (roads, nature, views, but no real city)
+activities
+lot of vehicles, moslty cars
+collectibles like murals - beautiful.

Top cons:
-game forces you to some things, like buying exact cars, completing A LOT of activities to e.g. unlock fast travel. 10 full playlists is definately too much for that reward. I get devs want us to visit whole island, but forcing is never proper way. Maybe they dont trust the players enough.
-another festival
-too easy progression, getting too much cars
-no big city
-no selling cars option
-necessity to buy certain cars, which you get anyway later, so you end up with multiple cars you dont really want
-steering of motorbikes
-really weird physics of boats sometimes
-drifting competitions - the fact that even soft touching of objects canceles the combo is just frustrating. In real world drifting you get extra points for "kissing the wall", here you are punished - not cool. Generaly I consider drifitng physics good, also depends on the car, but counting score is annoying at some moments.
-difficulty levels are very uneven. 4 is sometimes very easy, sometimes, quite challenging and gap to 5 is huge, too huge. 5 is sometimes easy and sometimes undoable, impossible to compete. Give opponents same cars as players get, not scripted ones. Make it fair.
-*the fact that you have to do same races, when in the crew, and that you dont progress if being on same stage, *although im not quite sure, if i check it properly

Is ok, but could be better:
\sense of speed
\sounds of cars
These two come from TDU Solar Crown, which shows how it can be done. I get it TCM has a lot more cars, and some of the sounds are really cool, but why not try aiming for better ones. Sense of speed from cockpit is cool, but from behind the car, again, TDU SC is better, therefore - pinned for moodboard. In case of sounds I'm being quite picky, it would just make perfect game, it's much better then TC2 for sure big improvement.
\UI - with that number of cars available its should be solved differently. Grid would help for example. Moving around single row looking for one brand at dealership or findind that one car among your cars might be too time-consuming for that simple task.
\not sure about relation between time reversing and time measurement and the fact it doesnt reverse as well. i get why it might be like that, but im not certain its best. And Im not a fan of reversing time mechanincs being available generally.

Generally I adore this game. Natural views are amazing. Unfortunately lacking really urban ones. Car game that is giving me absolute joy, which I didnt get for a while and didn't expect from this title. The cons I listed would give me the perfect car game I seek for a long time, but this one is suprisingly close. If I wouldnt be showered with money and cars, and get actual feel of progression and big city that would be perfect.

I don's usually write reviews, but i see potential in this game I didnt's see for a long time in this ganre, which i care about, and wanted to share some observations, feedback and feelings. Looking forward to more street vibe in this series in the future, if ubisoft survives.

Keep up the good work devs.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
My first 2 hours was constant server disconnections and a couple hard crashes and for a game so long after release that is simply unacceptable..

This being a Ubisoft game - a company that steals games from their customers means I don't have any trust it's even worth giving a chance on another day as they have likely stolen it by then.. so they forced me to make up my mind and I saw no other option than a refund and a negative review.

It's actually a bit of a shame as what I got to play was ( after a few option changes and ajustments ) not bad..  the graphics were good.. the wheel support and forcefeedback were surprisingly acceptable, the Hawaii setting was also good..

All in all it seemed like a perfectly good Forza-clone that I could have enjoyed, had it not been for the server issues... ( perhaps an offline option would have been a good choice eh Ubisoft )

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
I really wanted to like this game. I am all in on this idea of creating a worthy opponent for Forza Horizon.
I like missions, menus, game modes, but the most important thing is still just bad.
First of all, the driving on a controller is way worse than in Forza, but I would deal with it if not graphics and optimisation: you can't turn off the TAA that makes this game so blurry, the game is locked on 60 fps and, the main problem - it drops to 30 inconsistently. And no, it doesn't depend on my PC specs, it can run FH5 on ultra just fine, and it happens on every settings combination possible.
Ubisoft made a great game, but made it unplayable.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: i was bored with FH5 graphics,crew vibrant graphics are a good change of mood,overall fun game right from the start.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Don’t make the same mistake I did. Don’t play this game for an hour and think, "Meh, just another Ubisoft flop; Forza is better." I assure you, it’s not. This is, by far, the most enjoyable open-world racer I’ve ever played. It just takes a little time to get into. But once you do, it’s an absolute joy to play.

Over the past week, I’ve spent about 20 to 25 hours playing on both my Xbox Series X and PC (apparently running the game as an admin causes the ‘hours played’ to not display correctly). And so far, this has been an absolute blast.

The game modes are a great with a ton of variety (the playlist system is fantastic). The map looks absolutely stunning with a nice mix of urban, off-road, and jungle. The settings and tuning options make driving the cars a true pleasure. Plus, it has cross-save, so I can switch between my XSX and PC seamlessly. It's very much an arcade racer, not a sim, but if that’s your style, you won’t be disappointed.

The only downside for me is the performance. The game does have some micro-stutters and freezes, and it took a bit of tweaking to (mostly) even things out (turn off the Ubi overlay on PC—trust me). But once I got everything dialed in, it’s been smooth sailing. For reference, I’m running it on a 6650XT and a Ryzen 7 7700X.

Summary: This is one of the best—if not [i]the[/i] best—open-world arcade racing games out there. It’s not flawless, but it’s damn close and on sale, it is truly a steal.

Edit: Turn off CARA, voice, and subtitles. You can thank me later.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Looks Awesome, Driving Physic feels similar to TC2 and now you can finally destroy trees and small walls. overall good game but i had to refund it due to nonexisting Crossplay function. Only way to crossplay is in 2 gamemodes and only via Matchmaking not possible to play with friends across different Plattforms kinda sux.

still a good game but not for me

title: The Crew Motorfest

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Be forewarned: Racing through the "story mode" is not done with your own cars. Yet you are required to purchase some vehicles to progress, vehicles you will not use. 

Even with a heavy discount, The Crew: Motorfest is immensely disappointing. Racing with your own vehicles is seemingly discouraged as you are required to progress through "playlists" before being able to return in your own vehicles to race. The VOs during the racing are irritating to the point of myself muting them. Despite the inclusion of rally cars, there is only ONE dedicated rally race. Plenty of rally raids (cross country for those who played Forza), but they feel about as fun as they do in Forza (as in not very fun at all). And despite the inclusion of aircraft like racing planes and stunt planes, in Ubisoft fashion they are both slow and awful to fly. You cant even pull a loop or aeileron roll. Ubisoft remembered yaw exists, but made stunt planes unable to do stunts while flying at helicopter speeds. I really cant get over the fact the top speed of the aircraft is approaching their real-life counterpart's landing speed.

For the amount of obvious effort put in, it seems the developers forgot to make the game fun. The developers seemed to prioritize celebrity (or perhaps 'influencer' is a better word) cameos and digitalized history over refining what makes a racing game fun. I don't care all that much about 'Supercar Blondie' or 'Hoonigan' all that much, and while I like Donut Media, there are other members besides James Pumphrey. As for the parts of the game about car culture, they would be a lot more fun if they weren't shoved down our throats. I like learning about car culture and car history. Heck, I have a degree in history, but the information is so shallow and the delivery so irritating I'd get a superior experience by listening to a podcast while playing subway surfers.

TLDR: Its more like a really bad Crew 2 DLC than a full fledged sequel. I heavily regret giving it a chance past the refund period.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
The Crew franchise always had something that set it apart from the rest of open-world games, a map of the USA. But they decided to scrap that whole identity for this game to just focus on relatively small island. This game feels like it is a DLC for The Crew 2 not a standalone game. The map looks good and detailed yes, but what made past entries fun was to cruise on this huge map for hours.
Also, this game feels so bland, the non-existent story doesn't help either. The first 3 to 4 hours you just race loaned cars on already made playlists that are only set apart by the cars you drive in them.
To be honest if you want a good open world racing game you should buy The Crew 2 [spoiler](well since The Crew 1 is just gone)[/spoiler].

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: Didn't make it past the opening scenario and experienced two server disconnects and a crash when trying again. The TAA is hot trash and can't be turned off. Just stick with the crew 2.

Editing the Review.  Still no support from Ubisoft.   Will get hold of steam support to force a refund on this.  Latest email 16 Sept from Ubisoft Support explaining to me again my system requirements, and running a RTX 3060ti with Ryzen 7 5800x3d.  come on no ways!

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Before TCM ,I played 188h on my very first Racing game FH4
After 24.6h playtime of TCM and here's my thoughts

Pros
1. TCM has 3x bigger map than FH4 and it is fun and detailed, FH4 map was boring and 70% of the map were vegetation field and jungle
2. The story / playlist in TCM are way more interesting and diverse than FH4 
3. You can fly an airplane ,drive a boat and ride motorbike in TCM
4. Crew series more focus on playful and creative experience while FH series more on serious and professional experience
5. A lot of customization in TCM
6. Every playlist / story in TCM is unique, creative, plus with real life production cutscenes, in the other hand, most of the story/playlist in FH4 basically just driving from A to B
7. every race path in TCM is more challenging and every path felt different compare to FH4
8. Nitro and LED
9. Characters in TCM feels more alive while FH4 feels more robotic
10. More realistic weather
11. Lighting, reflection were so good compare to FH4
12. Environment physics was better in TCM

Cons
1. Crew series graphic/visual style more cartoon-ish, FH series more realistic
2. No NPC and animal in TCM
3. Less car in TCM
4. No offline mode and server can be unstable sometime
5. TCM In game menu not so user friendly
6. Most car physics and driving mechanism in TCM were less realistic than FH
7. Controlling was better and realistic in FH
8. Car mirror in TCM just a decoration
9. You cannot own any houses in TCM


Overall I really enjoy playing this game !

title: The Crew Motorfest

This is the best raceingamestorymode i played the last years. This game took a lot of the good stuff from "Forza Horizon" and "Need for Speed" and made it better. I payed below 20€ on sale on Steam, and this seems totally fair atm. I like Forza Horizon and NFS too, but this game is better than NFS Unbound because of the storymode. PC3, PC2 and Automoblista 2 are also good racinggames but they dont have such a good storymode. 

rx6600xt 8gb, 5800x, 32gb 3200MHz (the game needs like 15gb on high) amd driversetting rsr 1440 -> 4k 50" 1200Hz Panasonic TV HDR10 -> around 48 Fps on high -> looks really good and smooth

xbox one controller works perfect

thx to the devteam for this great work.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
There is no reason they dont have actual cross play. They for sure false advertise when they say they do have it. Can't even free roam with people on other platforms. You also can barely play with the people with you. 

I just don't understand how you go from The Crew 2.. where you had all the things for success and then you come out with this.

Many hours later, everything ive said before stands true. ALTHOUGH i will say; With time ive become invested. Don't beleive i judged to early, but i am genuinly enjoying myself. SO i would say keeping everything ive said in mind. Im changing my status to a YES.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: The most obvious cheating A.I. I've seen in a racing game that makes Mario Kart A.I. look tame by comparison. Constant rubber banding and catch up, seemingly unlimited boost, they'll even pull away for no reason whatsoever when not even using boost, impossible cornering at speeds that looks almost cartoonish. This game wishes it could be Forza Horizon.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Look, I hate Ubisoft as much as the next guy.  BUT I was genuinely surprised how fun this game is.

The presentation and driving is 100% much better than FH5, albeit the lack of a ''search'' setting on liveries kinda suck but the map is actually fun and interesting compared to the boring fields n empty wastes of FH5 

The cars also are actually good, FH5 would just hype you like crazy cause they were adding some granny's old Toyota Tercel or DLC packs with already-ingame cars just with cool parts like cmon man I want some cars for RACING! Here they separate em by classes instead of tuning so you won't be seeing some old fiat going at lightspeeds next to crazy lambos and bugattis 

The biggest complaint however is the beyond-glitchy Ubisoft overlay, yes I know me too at first I was like ''oh great more bloatware'' but at least they do something interesting with the system by doing challenges that grants you points to buy some ingame exclusive goodies which is actually impressive from some third-party installation . However it just freezes up on screen when it opens up, meaning you gotta close the game and open it up again whenever that happens. 

But yeah honestly if you want a fun arcade racer that doesnt dabble too much into realism and just want high speed, stunts and crazy cars give this one a go (especially if its on mega-sale like right now)

Oh and your main character is Gordon-Freeman'esque silent, and does not cringe-babble like in FH5. Thats a big win TBH

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: Very vibrant looking graphic, feels more like forza but in good way. There are lot of challenges, playlist, weekly challenges more. Lots of variety cars like crew 2. you can even gen your owned vehicle from crew 2 which is super+ advantages. Really fun to play this game 100% recommended

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: The game is fun.  I just wish there were a few more customization options like ride height, stance, change material/texture of the rims(they stay chrome no matter what color), and give us the option to go back to the stock rims if we wanted to.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
Great game, I had played the entire Fora horizon series my whole life and I didn't enjoy the last two recent horizons, decided to try the crew 2, loved that due to how vast that map is the amount of activities you can do, very fun. This game has that same amount of fun packed into a vibrant and beautiful island. 

This game and series in general still has work that needs to be done on it but it is by far much more fun than the current state of Forza, this is due to the fact that it incorporates multiple features that the developers know the community wants and the devs actually listened to the community and continue to improve the game. 

The progression system is great and you can tell this game was made with love and having fun in mind. Great experience, no complaints, very well done making a arcade game in between the likes of Need for speed, Forza & Midnight Club Racing. Keep up the good work, can't wait to see this series progress further!

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
The Crew Motorfest offers an outstanding racing experience, excelling in smooth handling, impressive graphics, and a great variety of cars. The vehicle selection is vast, and each car handles uniquely, making driving feel engaging and fun no matter what you're racing.

The visuals are top-notch, with detailed car models and beautifully designed environments that enhance the immersion. Whether you're speeding through urban streets or tearing up off-road trails, the graphics add to the thrill of the race.

One of the game's highlights is its variety of events. There’s always something new to do, with a broad selection of races and challenges that keep the gameplay fresh and exciting. The diversity of events ensures you’re never stuck doing the same thing twice, making every session feel different and engaging.

Although an offline mode is expected to be patched in at a later date, it’s currently an online-only experience. Once implemented, it will likely broaden the game's appeal, allowing players to enjoy it without needing a constant connection.

In short, The Crew Motorfest brings a compelling mix of fast-paced racing, stunning visuals, and varied gameplay, making it a strong contender for any racing fan’s collection—even more so when the offline mode arrives.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
The Crew Motorfest stands out as a serious competitor to Forza Horizon 5, and for good reason. It offers an incredible open-world experience with a massive map filled with endless exploration opportunities, thrilling races, engaging side-quests, and a wealth of challenges. The game's car handling feels superb, even for each car-type, delivering a realistic and satisfying driving experience that truly sets it apart.

One of the game's highlights is the wide variety of race playlists you can dive into, each offering unique themes and even car rewards, making the progression system highly rewarding and exciting. The stunning graphics bring the game's world to life, enhancing the overall immersion and making every race feel like a high-octane spectacle.

However, the game's difficulty system leaves room for improvement. The lower levels (1-2) are simply too easy, while level 3 is still on the easy side for seasoned racing gamers. Level 4 demands a good amount of skill just to place in the top 3, and level 5 feels nearly impossible. The AI's flawless driving and highly effective nitro usage make it extremely tough to catch up, and the marginal +4% reward isn't enough incentive, especially when the challenge feels unfair.

Despite this, The Crew Motorfest delivers an exhilarating racing experience packed with content and challenges that keep you coming back for more. If you're a fan of open-world racers, this game is definitely worth a spin!

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:

title: The Crew Motorfest
review: i like the game but my only problem is the loaned cars you use in the playlists are absolutely trash, i mean it feels like almost every car is a shitty tune in the middle of grip and drift lol. this shit is borderline impossible on 5/5 difficulty first playthrough, it would be really nice to adjust pro settings for the loaned cars just to be able to dial in suspension.  other than that this game is really nice, the environments are easily the best in a game like this. the handling is a lot to get used to if you come from carx titles or more sim like racing games in general, but it is for sure a blast. sad to see such a lack of tuning potential, but maybe in future updates the pro settings will expand. I really love the implementation of real car culture and the many facts you learn about automotive legends, it adds so much emotion to the game that really seals the deal. plus, lbwk playlist, cmon.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
10 hours in and here are my honest opinions.

I honestly don't understand the hate on this game. The visuals are exceptional, playlists are well designed, interface design is amazing! Even the Ubisoft Connect has been hassle free for me. The cinematics are well made, the collaborations are insane!

However, progressing in the game feels a bit slow and frustrating. It requires you to follow a specific format and buy vehicles that you don't want to. The difficulty level is so random. Everything from 1 to 4 difficulty feels childish and then 5 difficulty spawns the most perfect drivers on the planet lol.

Overall, I am having fun. I highly recommend to get it in a sale.

title: The Crew Motorfest
review:
First impressions:

All I've heard about this game is what it's not. It isn't as big of an open world as the previous games. It isn't Forza Horizon, but it really wants to be. So on and so forth.

I enjoyed previous two games in this series a lot, and I agree, it's definitely moving away from an identity of its own to be more of a rival to Forza Horizon (which I also enjoy a lot). This started with the previous game, but it's more apparent here. In some ways it's shameless; this game is trying to not only evoke that Forza Horizon festival feeling and its smorgasbord of activities to pursue. But it's also trying to capitalise on other elements of the open world racing genre that Forza Horizon fans have been crying out for. The game is set in a genre-favourite location famous from Test Drive Unlimited, and the very first playlist of events offered to you is all about Japanese car culture where they do a surprisingly good job of immersing you in a neon cityscape despite the game's setting being very much otherwise.

And I guess that's the thing. I've seen this game labelled as Aldi brand Forza Horizon, and it has perhaps earned that snark in chasing that game's success too obviously. But if it delivers fan-requested features and does it well... shouldn't that be celebrated? I can't speak to the endgame / live service aspect to this title yet, but if it's anything like The Crew 2, I'll be playing it just as much as I played Forza Horizon. Horizon remains the better game, probably, but this one is well worth playing too. They've much improved on the car handling from previous games, the open world feels more detailed for being smaller, and I'm a big fan of their events playlist system. I didn't even find the voiced characters all that cringeworthy... though the AI assistant could be toned down a bit.

Grabbed this on sale and I'm plenty happy with it.
